page.title: 12Emborough's Cheese Factory
page.content: This has been privately owned for 26 years. The milk is locally produced and the cheese traditionally made by hand and machine. This cheese is marketed locally but nationally distributed. Twenty eight farms provide the milk some of which are owned y the dairy. At the present time 9-10 tons of cheese are made every day. The process from milk to cheese takes about 5 hours. The cheese is then stored for about 7 months to mature. The Whey from the cheese has the last of the cream extracted and this is made into whey butter which is used for blending. The whey is finally fed to the pigs kept nearby and reared for pork and bacon.
